title: Large-Scale Federated Learning Design and Optimization in Wireless Edge Environments: Case Studies in Language Data Processing

context.prior_knowledge: Basic machine learning, fundamental wireless communication concepts, Python programming experience, and introductory NLP principles
context.additional_context: Students simultaneously engage in theoretical learning and hands-on practice with personal devices, demonstrating practical skills through project-based assessments. Simulates wireless edge computing environments centered on language domain cases, focusing on text data preprocessing and distributed learning optimization challenges.

learning_goals: Students can explain the operational principles and two-tier hierarchical structure of federated learning in wireless edge environments from a language data processing perspective.
Learners can mathematically model the trade-off between communication costs and learning performance as an optimization problem and propose accuracy improvement methods for language models.
Students can implement hierarchical clustering methods to design a federated learning system that reflects the importance of language data across devices.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
